On Wed, Aug 25, 2010 at 11:39 PM, Shay Thomps=
on <sthompso@...> wrote:
>
> I'm running a set of tests, some of whic=
h have a custom Annotation on them. =A0I'm using a custom Test Runner which=
 filters the tests and only runs the ones that have the custom Annotation. =
=A0The problem I'm having is that some classes have 0 tests with the custom=
 Annotation. =A0When that happens, the class still shows up in the report b=
ut lists 0 tests. =A0I'd prefer to only have a report with the tests that h=
ad the special Annotation, ie the ones that actually ran. =A0Is there a way=
 to exclude the others from the report? =A0I'm using Ant's junitreport task=
 to generate the report.
>
